text:
Hi guys! How can I add this invisible pixel manually into an email? What's the HTML code?
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/connected-email/understand-HubSpot-sales-email-open-and-click-tracking#:~:text=When%20you%20send%20a%20tracked%20email%2C%20HubSpot%20embeds%20an%20invisible,the%20email%20has%20been%20opened.&text=The%20recipient's%20corporate%20filter%20strips%20away%20all%20images%20for%20incoming%20emails>.
HubSpot inserts it automatically to every email sent from the system; no need for a developer to add any additional code!
I want to automate my email sending using a Google Sheet. That's why I need the code to manually add it to my emails.

As far as I know there’s no way to use that code if the email itself isn’t sent from HS. You could still send emails based on Google Sheets activity, but it would need to be done using the transactional/single-send API: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/how-to-use-transactional-email-in-HubSpot>
And why is that? What is this invisible pixel (image?) and why can't I insert it manually into an email?

The image is for tracking purposes; that’s how HS knows if an email has been opened or not for example. I believe the code is unique on a per-email basis (note, not per-send, but per-individual email), so it’s not like a single code can be generated as a one-time embed.
I see, thanks!
Going to look into transactional emails then
